alert.note: Alert for Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 10 at 1:26PM EST until December 11 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with localized amounts upwards of 5 inches on the higher ridges. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In Virginia, Western Highland County. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to noon EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute with snow covered and slippery surfaces. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will change to snow this evening between 7 and 9 PM with temperatures rapidly falling below freezing. The combination of snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility below one-half mile at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
